alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 7:29PM AKDT until July 17 at 8:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country in Alaska... Southeastern Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands in Alaska... * Until 800 PM AKDT. * At 728 PM AKDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 75 miles northwest of Eagle, or 95 miles southeast of Fort Yukon, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country and southeastern Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
